metadata.title: CVE-2010-3380 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The (1) init.d/slurm and (2) init.d/slurmdbd scripts in SLURM before 2.1.14place the . (dot) directory in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH, which allows localusers to gain privileges via a Trojan horse shared library in the currentworking directory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3380` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-slurm - 15.08.7-1build1
libpmi0 - 15.08.7-1build1
libslurm-perl - 15.08.7-1build1
libslurm29 - 15.08.7-1build1
libslurmdb-perl - 15.08.7-1build1
libslurmdb29 - 15.08.7-1build1
slurm-client - 15.08.7-1build1
slurm-client-emulator - 15.08.7-1build1
slurm-llnl - 15.08.7-1build1
slurm-llnl-slurmdbd - 15.08.7-1build1
slurm-wlm - 15.08.7-1build1
slurm-wlm-basic-plugins - 15.08.7-1build1
slurm-wlm-emulator - 15.08.7-1build1
slurm-wlm-torque - 15.08.7-1build1
slurmctld - 15.08.7-1build1
slurmd - 15.08.7-1build1
slurmdbd - 15.08.7-1build1
sview - 15.08.7-1build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: slurm-llnl package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '15.08.7-1build1').
